verses.roman:
nṛtyato gāyataḥ kvāpi
valgato yudhyato mithaḥ
gṛhīta-hastau gopālān
hasantau praśaśaṁsatuḥ

synonyms: nṛtyataḥ—who were dancing; gāyataḥ—singing; kva api—sometimes; valgataḥ—moving about; yudhyataḥ—fighting; mithaḥ—with one another; gṛhīta-hastau—holding Their hands together; gopālān—the cowherd boys; hasantau—laughing; praśaśaṁsatuḥ—They offered praise.
translation: Sometimes, as the cowherd boys danced, sang, moved about and playfully fought with each other, Kṛṣṇa and Balarāma, standing nearby hand in hand, would glorify Their friends' activities and laugh.
